data.title: The Top 100 Software Companies of 2023
data.text:
The Software Report is pleased to unveil the fourth annual Top 100 Software Companies. This esteemed awards publication has earned a reputation as the foremost authority on the best companies within the software industry. As always, the process of selecting involves carefully examining the feedback received from nominations and conducting in-depth research into a company's background, which includes publicly available information as well as insights from platforms such as Glassdoor, G2, Capterra, and other sources. Backed by a comprehensive approach, the Software Report considers a multitude of factors, including product functionality, customer satisfaction, corporate reputation, innovative capabilities, organizational depth, ESG involvement, and long-term viability, among numerous other criteria.

This year’s selections include a diverse range of companies, encompassing up and comers and massive tech giants. Awardees such as Adobe earned recognition through the company's dedication and consistent performance in delivering state-of-the-art digital media and marketing solutions. In parallel, we have the agile startup HighLevel, which was launched in 2018. Based in the Dallas/Fort Worth area of Texas, HighLevel's marketing and advertising platform has amassed more than 20,000 clients in a short period of time. Also deserving of acknowledgement is LexisNexis, a global data and analytics company with over 10,500 colleagues serving customers in 150+ countries.

Irrespective of the company's size or age, this year’s awardees are making a significant impact on the software industry within their specific domains, all while providing exceptional value to their customers. Please join us in recognizing and celebrating The Top 100 Software Companies of 2023.

1. Alteryx

Category: Data Management & Analytics

Location: Irvine, CA

Since its 1997 inception, Alteryx has been leading the democratization of data analytics and revolutionizing businesses through data science and analytics. The company, now led by CEO Mark Anderson, powers analytics for all by delivering the intuitive, end-to-end award-winning Alteryx Analytics Cloud Platform for: data engineering, data prep, analytics, machine learning, geospatial analytics, and AI-driven data storytelling.

In recent years, Alteryx has experienced significant growth and customer traction. The Alteryx Maveryx Community has grown to more than 2,600 employees. The company also boasts a clientele list of 8,300 customers, including global brands like L’Oreal, IBM, Porsche, Netflix, and more. Furthermore, Alteryx believes in supporting its communities through its social impact program, Alteryx for Good. On top of that, the company’s no-cost analytics education program, Alteryx SparkED, now works with 977 institutions globally, an 87% YoY increase in 2022. This includes more than 140,000 learners in over 50 countries.

2. Cvent

Category: Event Management

Location: Tysons Corner, VA

Cvent, a global-leading meetings, events and hospitality technology provider, is revolutionizing the way organizations manage and execute their events and drive business impact. With a strong market presence and a customer base that spans across nearly every industry, Cvent has experienced consistent growth over its 23+ year history, achieving impressive milestones in its journey including most recently being acquired by Blackstone, one of the largest private equity firms in the world, for $4.6 billion.

Headquartered in Tysons, Virginia, with 4,800+ employees globally, Cvent was founded in 1999 by Reggie Aggarwal, who continues to serve as the CEO. The company has grown exponentially over the years, helping its 21,000+ customers deliver more than 6 million events since 1999 and generating more than $14 billion of group business volume in 2022 alone, establishing itself as a trusted industry partner worldwide.

3. IFS

Category: Business Processes

Location: Linköping, Sweden

IFS is a global enterprise software company that was founded in 1983. It develops and delivers cloud enterprise software for companies around the world who manufacture and distribute goods, build and maintain assets, and manage service-focused operations. By offering industry-specific products connected to a single data model and infused with digital innovation, IFS enables its customers to streamline their operations and enhance their efficiency. Notably, the company serves a diverse range of industries, including Aerospace & Defense, Construction & Engineering, Energy, Utilities & Resources, Manufacturing, Service Industries, and Telecommunications.

Additionally, some of IFS’s notable clients include renowned companies such as Toyota, Hyundai, China Airlines, British Sky Broadcasting, and Shanghai Metro. With a strong global presence, IFS employs over 5,500 professionals across more than 80 countries. The company’s commitment lies in delivering value at every stage to its 10,000+ customers. More recently, in July 2022, IFS acquired Ultimo, a provider of cloud Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) software, complementing its existing offering allowing them the ability to offer Cloud native EAM solutions that cater for every company with either complex end-to-end business needs or as a standalone point solution.

4. Procore Technologies

Category: Business Processes

Location: Carpinteria, CA

Procore Technologies Inc. creates software for people who build the world. In 2002, founder and CEO Craig “Tooey” Courtemanche started Procore with a mission to connect everyone in construction on a global platform and a vision to improve their lives. Procore’s platform connects key project stakeholders to solutions Procore has built specifically for the construction industry—for the owner, the general contractor, and the specialty contractor. Because of its unlimited user and support model, Procore is able to connect everyone on one platform and offer unlimited storage, open APIs, and a single source of accurate and timely data.

Previously, more than 1 million projects and over $1 trillion in construction volume have run on Procore's platform. Today, with more than 15,700 customers and over 2 million annual users in 150+ countries, the company helps the construction industry build smarter—reducing risk, increasing efficiency, improving communication, protecting profits, and providing intelligent insights to help customers run better businesses. Headquartered in Carpinteria, California, the company has offices around the globe.

5. BlackLine

Category: Finance & Accounting

Location: Los Angeles, CA

BlackLine is a global company that was established in 2001 and is headquartered in Los Angeles CA. It is a leading provider of cloud software that automates and controls financial close and accounting processes. Companies choose BlackLine because their traditional manual accounting processes are no longer sustainable.

Founded in 2001 by Therese Tucker, former CTO of SunGuard Treasury Systems, the company set out to replace outdated Excel spreadsheets with an accounting-specific suite of solutions. Now under the direction of Ms. Tucker, alongside Co-CEO Owen Ryan, former CEO of Deloitte Advisory, BlackLine is considered a global industry leader with more than 4,300 customers including Coca-Cola, Domino’s, Dow, eBay, Nasdaq, and SiriusXM.

BlackLine has shown considerable recent growth, with revenues for 2022 up 23% over 2021, and continues to make significant strides in enhancing solutions for customers, solidifying its position as the market leader. BlackLine also continues to grow its world-class partner ecosystem to further penetrate the $39B+ opportunity in the financial close, accounts receivable, and intercompany accounting automation markets, partnering globally with such notable names as Accenture, Capgemini, Deloitte, EY, KPMG and SAP. As further testament to its success, BlackLine is recognized as the leader by customers at leading end-user review sites including Gartner Peer Insights, G2 and TrustRadius.

6. Adobe

Category: Publishing

Location: San Jose, California

Adobe, a global leader in digital media and marketing solutions, is driven by a core commitment to innovation, prioritizing employees, customers, and stakeholders. Over the past decade, Adobe has delivered hundreds of AI-powered capabilities across Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, and Experience Cloud. This empowers customers to create, collaborate, and work more efficiently, making the world more creative, productive, and personalized.

With a workforce of over 36,000 and headquartered in San Jose, CA, Adobe's creative, marketing, and document solutions benefit everyone, from emerging artists to global brands. Recent highlights include the launch of Adobe Express with Firefly, revolutionizing content creation and sharing. Adobe's Creative Residency program empowers the next generation of creators in collaboration with renowned museums. Partnerships with General Motors and the Prada Group enable real-time customer engagement and transformative in-store and digital experiences.

7. Planview

Category: Collaboration and Development

Location: Austin, TX

Planview has one mission: to build the future of connected work, from ideas to impact. Planview helps organizations accelerate the achievement of what matters most, supporting our customers from need to speed, from passion to progress, and from overhead to optimization.

Planview’s connected platform of solutions underpins the business and digital transformations of more than 4,500 customers globally, including 59 of the Fortune 100. The company empowers enterprises to improve time-to-market and predictability, increase efficiency to unlock capacity, and ensure their most strategic initiatives deliver the desired business outcomes.

8. Datadog

Category: Cloud Management

Location: New York, NY

Datadog is the leading monitoring and security platform for cloud applications, providing end-to-end traces, metrics, and logs for complete observability of applications, infrastructure, and third-party services. By leveraging our capabilities, businesses can ensure system security, prevent downtime, and deliver the best user experience. Their unified approach provides real-time observability and security across the entire technology stack, supporting digital transformation and cloud migration for organizations of all sizes and industries.

With headquarters in New York, Datadog's dedication to continuous improvement is evident through the recent extension of its cloud cost management capabilities with container cost allocation, cost monitors, and support for Microsoft Azure. Additionally, the launch of Workflow Automation enables faster resolution of application issues, further enhancing its efficiency and effectiveness. With over 5,000 employees, Datadog continues to be a leading force in the cloud application monitoring and security landscape.

9. Applied Systems

Category: InsurTech

Location: University Park, IL

Applied Systems is the leading global provider of cloud-based software that powers the business of insurance. Recognized as a pioneer in insurance automation and an innovation leader, Applied is the world’s largest agency and brokerage management systems provider, serving customers throughout the United States, Canada, the Republic of Ireland, and the United Kingdom. By automating the insurance lifecycle, Applied’s people and products enable millions of people worldwide to safeguard and protect what matters most.

For 40 years, Applied Systems has led an industry it helped create with a mission to continuously improve the business of insurance. Applied has had many successes and has continuously focused on proving its value in many ways. From partnerships, acquisitions, awards, and diversity initiatives, Applied has focused on efforts to be the indispensable partner in our industry.

10. Gainsight

Category: Customer Management

Location: San Francisco, CA

Gainsight is headquartered in San Francisco, CA. The company offers an innovative platform that helps companies of all sizes and industries achieve durable growth. Leading companies like GE Digital, SAP Concur, and Box rely on Gainsight to achieve their expansion goals. With Gainsight's industry-leading products – including Gainsight CS, PX, DH, and Customer Education – clients can easily scale their operations, gain a holistic view of their customers, and drive product adoption while preventing churn and fostering thriving customer communities. Gainsight's mission is to prove that you can succeed in business while putting humans first.

Company leaders prioritize innovative ideas, deep connections with communities, and industry-defining products. Their commitment to exceptional customer experiences drives their strategic partnerships, such as the recent acquisition of Northpass, a leading Customer Education Platform, and their collaboration with Productboard. With over 400 employees, Gainsight remains dedicated to delivering exceptional solutions that put customers at the heart of all product decisions.

11. CrowdStrike

Category: Cybersecurity

Location: Sunnyvale, CA

CrowdStrike, a global cybersecurity leader, has redefined modern security with the world’s most advanced cloud-native platform. Powered by the CrowdStrike Security Cloud and cutting-edge AI, their CrowdStrike Falcon® platform leverages real-time indicators of attack, threat intelligence, and enriched telemetry to deliver hyper-accurate detections, automated protection, elite threat hunting, and prioritized observability of vulnerabilities. Purpose-built in the cloud with a single lightweight-agent architecture, Falcon ensures rapid deployment, superior protection and performance, reduced complexity, and immediate time-to-value.

Headquartered in Sunnyvale, California, CrowdStrike has over 7,000 employees. They have earned recognition and strategic partnerships, including Best Endpoint Security for SC Awards Europe 2023, unveiling '1-Click XDR' for securing unmanaged cloud assets, partnering with Pax8 for MSP cybersecurity, achieving IL5 Authorization for U.S. Department of Defense, and collaborating with AWS to advance AI in cybersecurity. CrowdStrike continues to lead in stopping breaches.

12. Lexis Nexis

Category: Data Management & Analytics

Location: New York City, NY

LexisNexis is a global data and analytics company with over 10,500 colleagues serving customers in 150+ countries. As a leading provider of legal, regulatory, and business information and analytics, LexisNexis Legal & Professional helps customers increase productivity, improve decision-making, and advance the rule of law worldwide. They assist lawyers in winning cases, managing work efficiently, and serving clients better. For corporations, they aid in understanding markets, monitoring brands, and mitigating business risk. Additionally, LexisNexis collaborates with universities to educate students and supports nation-building efforts by making laws accessible and strengthening legal infrastructures.

Headquartered in New York City, LexisNexis Legal & Professional is part of RELX Group, a global provider of information and analytics for professional and business customers across industries. The company has received recognition for its solutions, such as the Best Big Data Reporting & Analytics Solution award for LexisNexis Insurance Market Insights and being ranked as a Category Leader in four payment risk categories by Chartis Research.

13. Veeva

Category: Cloud Management

Location: San Francisco, CA

Veeva is the leading provider of cloud software for the life sciences industry, offering comprehensive industry cloud solutions that encompass data, software, services, and an extensive ecosystem of partners. Their platform supports critical functions from research and development to commercialization, helping companies of all sizes expedite product launches, streamline processes, and maintain compliance. With a strong focus on innovation, product excellence, and customer success, Veeva serves over 1,000 customers, including major biopharmaceutical companies and emerging biotechs.

Headquartered in Pleasanton, California, Veeva has a global presence with offices in Canada, Europe, Asia, and Latin America. The company is experiencing rapid growth and plans to expand its workforce to 10,000 employees by 2025. Veeva has recently achieved significant milestones, including partnerships with renowned companies like Merck KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany, to transform medical information operations globally. They also collaborate with educational institutions, such as St. Cloud State University, to provide real-world clinical technology experience to medtech students.

14. Diligent

Category: Collaboration and Development

Location: New York, NY

Diligent is the global leader in modern governance, offering SaaS solutions for governance, risk, compliance, audit, and ESG. Over one million users, including 750,000 board members and leaders, rely on Diligent software to gain a holistic view of their organization's practices and make better, faster decisions. As pioneers of the modern governance movement, Diligent serves one million users from 25,000 customers worldwide, providing a connected perspective on governance, risk, compliance, and ESG. Headquartered in New York with over 2,000 employees, Diligent empowers leaders to drive impact, accountability, and purpose in their organizations and create a more sustainable and equitable world.

Recent achievements include the launch of Diligent Institute's Cyber Risk & Strategy Certification for Corporate Directors and Executives, the introduction of Diligent Data's ESG Module for benchmarking efforts against peers, and expanding partnerships with entities like PwC Canada, Vervantis, Clarity AI, and more to enhance integration with the industry's leading GRC platform.

15. Phreesia

Category: Business Processes

Location: Wilmington, DE

Phreesia is the trusted leader in patient activation, giving providers, health plans, life sciences companies and other organizations tools to help patients take a more active role in their care. Founded in 2005, Phreesia enabled more than 120 million patient visits in 2022–more than 1 in 10 visits across the U.S.–scale that we believe allows us to make meaningful impact. Offering patient-driven digital solutions for intake, outreach, education and more, Phreesia enhances the patient experience, drives efficiency and improves healthcare outcomes.

16. Tebra

Category: IT Management

Location: Corona del Mar, CA

In 2021, with a combined mission to unlock better healthcare, Kareo and PatientPop joined forces to form Tebra — a complete practice automation solution for independent healthcare practices and billing companies. Today Tebra provides the digital tools and support built to help independent practices attract new patients, deliver modern care, get paid quickly, and operate efficiently. From a powerful EHR to cutting-edge automation tools, Tebra’s products come together to form the complete operating system for practice success. The company also notably makes it easier for patients to access the care they need and provides the digital conveniences they have grown to expect from their providers.

The name Tebra is derived from the word “vertebrae” and symbolizes the role the company serves as the backbone of practice success, delivering digital technology to connect providers and their patients. Headquartered in Southern California, Tebra currently has approximately 1,000 employees supporting close to 150,000 healthcare providers who are delivering care to more than 123 million patients in the U.S.

17. Unit4

Category: Business Processes

Location: Delray Beach, FL

Unit4 was founded in 1980 by Chris Ouwinga and listed on the Amsterdam Stock Exchange in 1998. The software company designs and delivers enterprise software and ERP applications and related professional services for people in services organizations, with a special focus on the professional services, education, public services, and nonprofit sectors. It has subsidiaries and offices in 26 countries across Europe, North America, the Asia-Pacific region, and Africa.

The company’s software is available in either cloud or on-premises setups. Notably, Unit4 is best known for its People Experience Suite, including Unit4 ERP, Unit4 Financials, Unit4 FP&A, Unit4 Talent Management. In 2015, Unit4 announced a partnership with Microsoft to build self-driving business applications on the Microsoft Azure cloud. Today Unit4 serves more than 5,100 customers around the world.

18. Seismic

Category: Data Management & Analytics

Location: San Diego, CA

​​Seismic, the global leader in enablement, empowers organizations to engage customers, enable teams, and drive revenue growth. Their Seismic Enablement Cloud™️ stands as the most powerful, unified enablement platform, equipping customer-facing teams with the essential skills, content, tools, and insights needed to thrive and achieve success. Trusted by over 2,000 organizations worldwide, from large enterprises to startups and small businesses, Seismic is the go-to solution for enablement needs.

Headquartered in San Diego, Seismic has a strong global presence, with offices spanning North America, Europe, and Australia. Some of Seismic's notable achievements include securing the #1 spot on G2's 2023 Best Software Awards for Best Products for Enterprise, collaborating with leading investment banks to enhance productivity through automation and personalization at scale, and being recognized as a Leader by an independent research firm for building "the most comprehensive solution in the marketplace." These accolades reflect Seismic's dedication to providing top-tier enablement solutions to drive success for its clients.

19. Odoo

Category: Business Processes

Location: Grand Rosière, Belgium

Odoo is a leading suite of open-source business applications, covering all your company needs: CRM, eCommerce, accounting, inventory, point of sale, project management, and more. Founded in 2002 by Fabien Pinckaers, its current CEO, Odoo has gained popularity with over 107 million users and 2,000+ installations created daily. The unique value proposition of Odoo lies in its easy-to-use interface and seamless integration of all its apps. It's actively programmed, supported, and organized by Odoo SA, with a thriving global community of 1,500+ active members and 4,500+ contributed modules.

Notably, Odoo serves as an open-source alternative for various software packages and is used by retailers for POS and websites with its CMS synchronized with the eCommerce app. It competes with ERP solutions like SAP ERP, Oracle E-Business Suite, and Microsoft Dynamics. With offices in the US, Belgium, Luxembourg, India, Hong Kong, Dubai, and Mexico, Odoo employs over 3,000 professionals and has received significant investments from General Atlantic to fuel global growth.

20. Kaseya

Category: IT Management

Location: Miami, FL

Kaseya is a leading provider of unified IT management and security software, catering to managed service providers (MSPs) and small to medium-sized businesses (SMBs). Their customer-centric approach delivers top-notch technologies that enable organizations to efficiently manage, secure, and backup their IT infrastructure. The comprehensive suite of IT management solutions offered by Kaseya includes popular brands like: Kaseya, Datto, IT Glue, RapidFire Tools, Spanning Cloud Apps, ID Agent, Vonahi, audIT, Graphus, RocketCyber, TruMethods, and Unitrends.

Their solutions empower businesses to centralize IT command, manage remote and distributed environments, simplify backup and disaster recovery, bolster cybersecurity defenses, handle compliance requirements, streamline IT documentation, and automate various IT management tasks. With its headquarters in Miami, Florida, Kaseya operates globally, serving customers in over 20 countries.

21. Acronis

Category: Cybersecurity

Location: Switzerland

Acronis is a leading Swiss global technology company, founded in Singapore. It is dedicated to protecting the data, applications, systems, and productivity of organizations worldwide. They offer cybersecurity solutions that safeguard against cyberattacks, hardware failures, natural disasters, and human errors. Acronis empowers service providers to protect their infrastructure and clients with high profit margins. They also enable corporate IT teams and home office users to secure their critical infrastructure with reliability and cost-effectiveness.

With a global presence, Acronis is trusted by over 5.5 million home users and 500,000 companies, including all Fortune 1,000 companies. Their products are available through a vast network of 50,000 partners and service providers in more than 150 countries and 40 languages. Headquartered in Schaffhausen, Switzerland, Acronis is a reliable and innovative choice for cyber protection, earning recognition for its growth and channel-focused approach.

22. OneTrust

Category: Business Processes

Location: Atlanta, GA

OneTrust believes in the power of positive impact to drive business success in the modern world. With a strong ecosystem of customers, partners, employees, and communities, OneTrust delivers the Trust Intelligence Platform—a market-leading solution that seamlessly connects privacy, GRC (Governance, Risk, and Compliance), ethics, and ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) teams, data, and processes. Their exceptional platform has earned them the title of the #1 fastest-growing company on the Inc. 500 and a category-defining enterprise software that operationalizes trust and transparency.

Today over 14,000 customers, including half of the Global 2,000, rely on OneTrust to enable responsible data use, protect privacy rights, implement and report on cybersecurity, achieve social impact goals, and foster a culture of trust. OneTrust employs over 2,000 people across North America, South America, Asia, Europe, and Australia. Headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, OneTrust is making a global impact on business practices.

23. Majesco

Category: InsurTech

Location: Morristown, NJ

Established in 1982, Majesco is a prominent provider of insurance solutions and services, renowned for its expertise in the industry. Over the years, the company has built a strong reputation as a leading software provider for core insurance functions. Their comprehensive suite of software solutions encompasses Policy Administration, Underwriting, New Business Processing, Billing, Claims, Product Modeling, Incentive Compensation, and Producer Lifecycle Management. In addition to its software offerings, Majesco also offers consulting services and insurance-specific IT services. These include testing, data conversion, data warehousing, mobility solutions, and enterprise integration, among others.

Majesco is headquartered in Morristown, New Jersey. Notably, the company boasts a workforce of more than 2,000 skilled professionals who are dedicated to delivering top-notch services and solutions in several countries - the United Kingdom, Canada, India, Australia, Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, China, and Japan. With their commitment to blending cutting-edge technology with insurance expertise, Majesco remains at the forefront of the insurance industry, helping their clients thrive in an ever-evolving market.

24. Fastly

Category: Customer Management

Location: San Francisco, CA

Fastly is the global leader in a powerful and programmable edge cloud platform, enabling top brands to deliver the fastest online experiences while enhancing site performance, security, and innovation at a global scale. Trusted by thousands of organizations worldwide, including Reddit, Pinterest, Stripe, and The New York Times, Fastly's edge compute, delivery, security, and observability offerings have earned recognition from industry analysts like IDC, Forrester, and Gartner. Notably, their world-class support consistently achieves over 95% customer satisfaction ratings.

Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, Fastly's team of 1,800 employees is dedicated to upgrading the internet experience for billions of users. Recent achievements include being selected by Google for the Privacy Sandbox Initiative to enhance online privacy and launching a Managed Security Service to protect against web application attacks.

25. SoftwareONE

Category: Cloud Management

Location: Milwaukee, WI

SoftwareOne is a leading global software and cloud solutions provider, empowering clients to unlock the full value of their technology investments. With successful digital strategies, businesses can compete, scale, and innovate better while achieving permanent cost savings. The company redefines how organizations build, buy, and manage everything in the cloud, helping clients migrate and modernize their workloads and applications. By navigating and optimizing software and cloud changes, SoftwareOne maximizes the value of technology for its clients.

With a team of approximately 8,900 dedicated employees, SoftwareOne delivers a diverse portfolio of 7,500 software brands, offering sales and delivery capabilities in 90 countries. Headquartered in Switzerland, the company is listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange under the ticker symbol SWON. Through its comprehensive solutions and expertise, SoftwareOne enables organizations worldwide to embrace the power of technology and drive growth and innovation in today's dynamic digital landscape.

26. Ridgeline

Category: Finance & Accounting

Location: Incline Village, NV

Founded in 2017 by visionary entrepreneur Dave Duffield, co-founder of PeopleSoft and Workday, Ridgeline is an industry-leading cloud platform designed for investment management. With Ridgeline, investment firms can rely on one comprehensive system, a true single book of record that eliminates uncertainty. This unified platform empowers the entire organization, ensuring consistent, accurate data across all levels - from relationship managers engaging with clients to portfolio managers making crucial investment decisions, to back-office operations managing transactions and reporting.

The company was created to address the unique technological challenges faced by the industry, offering new thinking and innovation. Headquartered in Lake Tahoe, with offices in Reno and Manhattan, Ridgeline takes pride in being a fast-growing, people-first company that has gained recognition from Inc.

27. Acquia

Category: Customer Management

Location: Boston MA

Acquia is a software-as-a-service company co-founded by Dries Buytaert and Jay Batson to provide enterprise products, services, and technical support for the open-source web content management platform Drupal. It is an open-source digital experience company that empowers the world’s most ambitious brands to embrace innovation and create customer moments that matter. They have over 1,000 employees across locations and serve more than 4,000 customers, including Warner Music Group, NBC Sports, Pfizer, and the Australian Government.

The company empowers its clients to create digital customer experiences that matter. With open-source Drupal at its core, the Acquia Digital Experience Platform (DXP) enables marketers, developers, and IT operations teams at thousands of global organizations to rapidly compose and deploy digital products and services that engage customers, enhance conversions, and help businesses stand out. Acquia has been recognized as one of the fastest-growing private companies in the US by Inc. Magazine and Deloitte.

28. Boomi

Category: IT Management

Location: Chesterbrook, PA

Boomi was founded in Berwyn, Pennsylvania, and first launched its services in 2000. Today the company makes it simple for organizations to unlock the power of their data by quickly and easily connecting applications, processes and people for better, faster business outcomes.

The pioneer of cloud-native, integration platform as a service (iPaaS), Boomi radically simplifies the complexity of enterprise software by connecting everyone to everything, anywhere. Approximately 20,000 customers globally choose Boomi’s low-code platform to intelligently connect, automate, manage, and orchestrate their data, applications and processes – saving thousands of hours in development costs while addressing digital transformation imperatives. As of 2020, Boomi has approximately 1,300 employees.

29. Sonatype

Category: IT Management

Location: Fulton, MD

Software development is evolving. Today 90% of modern applications use open source code, and for good reason—speed. But when open source components go unmaintained, they become liabilities that leave organizations open to security and licensing risks. Recognized by globally renowned analysts as an industry leader, Sonatype enables speed and security in open source development, allowing organizations to innovate faster and at scale in a highly competitive market. The company was founded in 2008. It maintains headquarters in Fulton, Maryland.

The Sonatype Platform gives organizations total control of their SDLC for more confidence in every piece of open source code, source code, and containerized code. It unites software developers, application security professionals, engineering leaders, and legal teams to manage their open source components safely so that they can focus on innovation. More than 2,000 organizations, including 70% of the Fortune 100, and 15 million software developers rely on Sonatype’s tools and guidance.

30. Quadient

Category: Data Management & Analytics

Location: Bagneux, France

Quadient is a global leader supporting hundreds of thousands of customers worldwide in achieving personalized and excellent customer experiences. Their solutions enable organizations to create and deliver meaningful interactions consistently across all channels.

With a track record of dependable solutions, Quadient stays ahead of market trends, delivering approximately 8 billion personalized experiences annually. Focused on Intelligent Communication Automation, Parcel Locker Solutions, and Mail-Related Solutions, Quadient simplifies connections between people and what matters.

Headquartered in Bagneux, France, Quadient has 3,614 employees driving meaningful customer experiences. Notable achievements include customer adoption of Quadient's Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable Cloud Solutions in the UK and their partnership with PacificSource Health Plans to elevate member communications.

31. Vistex

Category: Data Management & Analytics

Location: Hoffman Estates, IL

In 1999, Sanjay Shah identified a gap in the ERP market for managing pricing, trade, royalties, and incentives critical for revenue growth. He decided to build Vistex solutions to address this need, and within two years, the first version was launched and gained rapid popularity. Today, with 21 global offices and 1,500+ employees, Vistex is relied upon by leading brands like GM, Barilla, and Bayer to drive revenue.

Furthermore, the Vistex Foundation's charitable initiatives are also making a positive impact worldwide. All of this success is based on Vistex solutions, which empower businesses to take control of their mission-critical processes, including pricing, trade, royalties, and incentives. With clear visibility into the numbers, stakeholders can see what strategies work best and ensure every dollar spent or earned contributes to real growth, not just additional costs. Backed by Accel-KKR, Vistex continues to expand, serving more customers, introducing new products, and establishing a strong global presence.

32. Xactly Corporation

Category: Intelligent Revenue Solutions

Location: Los Gatos, CA

Xactly is a leading software company founded by a sales leader, for salespeople. Xactly’s AI-powered Intelligent Revenue Platform gives Revenue Operations teams the data they need to power sales leaders to plan with agility, motivate with intention, and predict with conviction. It’s on a mission to transform the sales industry with AI to power sales to deliver results regardless of circumstances.

The company was founded in 2005 by Chris Cabrera, the current CEO, and went public in 2015, raising $96 million in its IPO. In 2017, Vista Equity Partners completed an acquisition of Xactly, establishing a partnership between the two entities. With a diverse customer base spanning multiple industries, including technology, finance, banking, healthcare, manufacturing, telecommunications, and retail, Xactly is dedicated to delivering excellent customer value and driving success.

Xactly’s strong workplace culture, centered on belonging, diversity, and inclusion, has earned them numerous awards and recognition. With employees across the globe and headquarters in Los Gatos, the company excels in providing reliable, innovative, and effective solutions that provide tangible results for its customers.

33. Outreach.io

Category: Data Management & Analytics

Location: Seattle, Washington

Outreach is the leading AI-powered sales execution platform that empowers sales teams to achieve higher productivity and successfully close more deals. From prospecting to deal management to forecasting, its platform leverages automation and artificial intelligence to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of all go-to-market activities and personnel across the revenue cycle. With over 5,500 companies, including prominent names such as Zoom, Siemens, Okta, DocuSign, and McKesson, relying on Outreach to drive their revenue organizations forward, Outreach has earned the trust of the market.

Headquartered in Seattle, Washington, Outreach has a global presence with offices worldwide, enabling it to cater to diverse customer needs effectively. Recent developments include the launch of Outreach Marketplace, a customer and partner-oriented platform, along with an integration with HubSpot, a partnership with Corporate Visions to drive enterprise sales digital transformation, and the introduction of new features to empower sales leaders in generating more pipeline and closing deals predictably. Additionally, Outreach now offers data sharing on the Snowflake Data Cloud, further enhancing its capabilities.

34. WorkForce Software

Category: HR Processes

Location: Livonia, MI

​​​​WorkForce Software is a global provider of workforce management solutions with integrated employee experience capabilities. The company’s WorkForce Suite is designed to cater to the unique needs of organizations, including pay rules, labor regulations, and schedules. By delivering a breakthrough employee experience at the time and place work happens, WorkForce Software helps organizations optimize their workforce, ensure compliance, and increase employee engagement for enhanced resilience and performance.
